channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Ongoing fly tipping issue on Grove Lane, 4th January
item.description:
Once again this single green bin is overflowing with fly tipped rubbish. Rather than just using council resources to clear it, why can’t a permanent solution be found? It’s a health hazard, an eye sore and affects everyone on the street. Photo taken 5 January.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16, Grove Lane, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bins not emptied for a number of weeks, 4th January
item.description:
Communal bins (general rubbish, recycling and food waste) for mylne apartments (93 Barrett’s grove, N168AP) haven’t been emptied for a number of weeks now. Bins are completely overflowing and urgently need to be emptied.This has become a reoccurring issue
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Barretts Grove, Hackney, London

item.title: Grifter required! Road is iced over and dangerous, 4th January
item.description:

item.title: People have dumped alot of rubbish my the recycle bins on every corner of the play space including beds and mattresses, 4th January
item.description:
There is a huge pile of rubbish by one of the bins and also rubbish and beds and mattresses surrounding the other bins. We also have a rat problem in this area so leaving this too long will escalate an already big problem.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Haddo Street, Greenwich

item.title: Ice, 4th January
item.description:
Treacherous conditions on roads in Towncourt crescent and surrounding roads for the past 5 days. Where are the gritters? This is not acceptable.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Towncourt Crescent, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Severely pavement outside Almshouses on Wandsworth Road, 4th January
item.description:
Following the renovation work to the front driveway and garden of the Almshouses on Wandsworth Road, the paving stones on the public pavement have severely cracked. This has been the case for at least a year, (if not longer). As a result there have been two incidents (that I know of) of people tripping and injury themselves. One young boy tripped resulting in cuts to his knees and grazes to hands and elbows. The other incident was an elderly man who tripped and cut his head. I just happened to be walking by when these happened so I’m unsure if any other injuries have been sustained.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 705, Wandsworth Road, Clapham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Swathes of rubbish along curb, 4th January
item.description:
The street is rarely cleaned and lots of rubbish has been blown or knocked off the curb into the gutter/road. Currently glass and plastic bottles, bags, clothes, dog poo littering the place. Further up the street is an oven rack sitting in the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ravenscroft Road, Anerley, Greater London
